column3: str

<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
The grief-stricken Shetona senses you might understand his pain.
Speak with Melancholy.
Deliver the sack of coin to the Nexus Arcade shopkeep.
Present the grief-stricken Shetona with the bottle of Alexandrian wine.
I lost a close friend of mine in that raid on the city... I know it's a lot to ask, but would you mind helping me give him a proper send-off?
I saw you weren't wearing a regulator─figured you'd understand what I'm going through. It feels like everyone else has already forgotten all about him...
I'm planning on packing a bunch of his belongings and a bottle of his favorite vintage in a box, then burying the whole lot in the cemetery in Heritage Found.
If you're up to the task, I'd have you source a bottle of Alexandrian wine for me.
Your best bet is speaking to the owner of the Neon Stein. Once you've got the goods, come meet me by the entrance to the city.
After a bottle of Alexandrian wine, are you? Afraid we don't serve that here.
Not the sort of thing the regulars go for. Heard it's perfectly drinkable, though. White wine─made right here in Everkeep, if you can believe it. Anyway, never had cause to stock the stuff.
How about trying your luck in the Nexus Arcade? Can get near enough anything there if you know who to ask.
You might be able to pick up a bottle in the Nexus Arcade. If I were you I'd head there.
Alexandrian wine? Yes, we have several bottles in stock. I should warn you, it comes at a premium...
A pleasure doing business with you! Here.
If there's anything else I can help you with, don't hesitate to ask.
There you are. I've just about managed to gather up all of his belongings. Any luck finding the wine?
Appreciate you going to all that trouble. This was his favorite tipple...

Me and him, we came from completely different backgrounds, but none of that mattered. Thirty years ago, I was going through a rough patch─everything was changing right before my eyes─and he stuck with me through it all.

There was one thing we didn't agree on, though: regulators. He never gave up trying to make me wear one of the damn things. But when <Emphasis>I</Emphasis> die, I want to go naturally, you know─back to the land and all that.

In the end, getting killed over and over again during the attack whittled his soul stock down to zero. Look, if people want to keep on wearing their regulators, I won't try and stop them, but it just isn't for me.

As it stands, I'm pretty much the only one left who remembers the poor bastard. I may get the funeral rites wrong─I mean, I'm sure his kind have their own way of doing things─but he'll just have to make do.
Anyway, I'm off to Heritage Found. Thanks again for helping me out. I owe you one.
